pro.zackpollard.telegrambot.api.conversations

Class Conversation

  • java.lang.Object
    • pro.zackpollard.telegrambot.api.conversations.Conversation

  • public final class Conversation
extends java.lang.Object
    This object represents a conversation between the bot and a chat. A conversation is a structure of prompts/messages that follow with a user.
    Author:
    Mazen Kotb
    See Also:
    builder(TelegramBot)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Conversation.ConversationBuilder
      The builder used to create conversations.
      static class  Conversation.PromptsBuilder
      A builder for prompts

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accept(Message message)
      Send internally; uses message to process the prompt, and move on to the next one.
      Conversation begin()
      Initiates the conversation with the first prompt, registers the conversation in the registry.
      static Conversation.ConversationBuilder builder(TelegramBot bot)
      Creates a builder for a conversation
      void end()
      Calls the conversation end method of the current prompt, and removes conversation from registry.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static Conversation.ConversationBuilder builder(TelegramBot bot)
        Creates a builder for a conversation
        Parameters:
        bot - The bot which you wish to use for the conversation
        Returns:
        a new conversation builder

      • begin

        public Conversation begin()
        Initiates the conversation with the first prompt, registers the conversation in the registry.
        Returns:
        The current conversation

      • accept

        public boolean accept(Message message)
        Send internally; uses message to process the prompt, and move on to the next one. Calls the end() method if there are no further prompts. Do not call unless you understand what you're doing.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be processed
        Returns:
        If the message prompted a prompt
        See Also:
        end()

      • end

        public void end()
        Calls the conversation end method of the current prompt, and removes conversation from registry.
        See Also:
        ConversationPrompt.conversationEnded(ConversationContext)
